title: US State Department starts firing more than 1,350 workers
byline: The State Department began firing more than 1,350 U.S.-based employees on Friday as the administration of President Donald Trump presses ahead with an unprecedented overhaul of its diplomatic corps, a move critics say will undermine U.S. ability to defend and promote U.S. interests abroad.

title: Gates Foundation pledges support for Sri Lanka’s child nutrition and education initiatives
byline: A meeting between Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya and the Global Development Chair and the delegation of the Gates Foundation, an American philanthropic foundation established by Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates and his wife Melinda Gates, was held on Friday at the Parliament.

title: At least 23 dead after airstrike on Buddhist monastery in Myanmar
byline: An airstrike on a Buddhist monastery in Myanmar ’s central Sagaing region killed at least 23 people who were taking shelter in the compound, separate sources said Friday.

title: Kosgoda shooting victim was not intended target of gunmen – Police
byline: Authorities have uncovered further details regarding the shooting incident that occurred last afternoon (11) in the Hataramanhandiya area of Kosgoda, Balapitiya.

title: Showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers will occur at times in the Sabaragamuwa Province and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle, and Matara districts.

title: Tense situation following fatality during police chase in Vavuniya
byline: A tense situation has arisen in Kuman Kulam, Vavuniya, following the death of a motorcyclist who was allegedly attempting to evade police officers last night (July 11).

title: US Tariffs on Sri Lanka and Philippines may shift trade advantage to India - Report
byline: India could pose stiff competition to Sri Lanka and the Philippines for nearly a fifth of their exports to the United States as both countries are facing high import duties under new US trade arrangement, according to an analysis.

title: Pakistan Army Chief Asim Munir to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Pakistan Army Chief Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir plans to visit Sri Lanka and Indonesia later this month, according to media reports.

title: Jagath Manuwarna elected Chair of Parliamentary Caucus on Arts & Culture
byline: Member of Parliament Jagath Manuwarna has been elected as the Chair of the Parliamentary Caucus on Arts and Cultural Affairs at its inaugural meeting held yesterday (July 11) in Parliament.

title: China, Sri Lanka vow to deepen strategic cooperative partnership as FMs meet
byline: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Saturday met with his Sri Lankan counterpart Vijitha Herath in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, and the two sides vowed to deepen their strategic cooperative partnership and enhance practical cooperation.

title: 21 illegally imported motorcycles, 4 cannabis plants seized at Hambantota Bird Park
byline: Police officers attached to the Central Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) have taken into custody 21 motorcycles that were illegally imported into the country, found inside a storage facility at the Birds Park Hambantota.

title: Trump nominates Eric Meyer as next US Ambassador to Sri Lanka
byline: The White House has announced the nomination of Eric Meyer, a career diplomat from California, as the next Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the United States of America to the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ warning for strong winds and rough seas off the coast extending from Puttalam to Pottuvil via Colombo, Galle and Hambantota.

title: Engine fuel supply was cut just before Air India jet crash, preliminary report says
byline: A cut in the fuel supply to the engines caused last month’s Air India crash that killed 260 people, a preliminary report has found.

title: President says US tariff cut achieved through talks, further reductions sought
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that, as a result of recent discussions with the United States, the previously imposed reciprocal tariff rate on Sri Lanka was successfully reduced from 44% to 30%.

title: Justin Bieber releases new album after 4-year music hiatus
byline: After a four-year hiatus, Justin Bieber has announced his return to the music scene with a brand new album.

title: US trade tariff: Sri Lanka must diversify export products and markets - expert
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump’s decision to impose a reciprocal tariff of 30 percent on imports from Sri Lanka will come into effect on August 01, 2025.

title: High Posts Committee approves appointment of 04 Ministry Secretaries
byline: The Committee on High Posts, which convened recently in Parliament under the patronage of the Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, has granted its approval for the appointment of four secretaries to ministries.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today (11), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: “Let’s build a nation rooted in historical heritage” – President Dissanayake
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that a society cannot progress without a meaningful connection to its historic heritage and that the nation’s development path must be chosen accordingly.

title: ASPI surpasses 18,500 for first time ever
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) reached a significant milestone today (11) as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 18,500-points mark for the first time in the capital market’s history.

title: 2024 O/L Exam Results: 13,392 students obtain 9A passes
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, A.K.S. Indika Kumari, announced that a total of 237,026 students have qualified for the G.C.E. Advanced Level based on the results of the 2024 G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination.

title: 2025 G.C.E. A/L exam dates announced
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, A.K.S. Indika Kumari has announced that the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination is scheduled to be held from 10th November to 5th December 2025.

title: Prime Minister briefs MPs on proposed new education reforms
byline: The first awareness programme on the proposed education reforms, scheduled to be implemented from 2026, was held on Friday (July 11) at the Parliament complex under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Petition filed against barring women from ‘Station Master’ posts
byline: The Supreme Court of Sri Lanka today (11) granted leave to proceed with a fundamental rights petition filed by two women challenging the gender-based restriction preventing women from applying for the position of Station Master in Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Shooting incident reported in Panadura, one injured
byline: An individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident reported in Hirana, Panadura earlier today (11), police said.

title: UK trade reforms set to boost Sri Lankan apparel exports and jobs
byline: Sri Lanka stands to benefit significantly from the UK’s latest trade reforms, as the British government unveiled a series of upgrades to the Developing Countries Trading Scheme (DCTS) on 10 July.

title: Mattala Airport still years away from being flight-ready – Minister
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation, Bimal Rathnayake, stated that it will take several more years to make the Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) fully operational for commercial flights.

title: Boost for Sri Lankan garment sector after new UK trade measures
byline: Sri Lankan garment sector is set to benefit following reforms by the British government to simplify imports from developing countries like Sri Lanka.

title: One person injured in Kosgoda shooting
byline: One person has been injured in a shooting incident in the Kosgoda area this evening (11).

title: Substandard drug imports: Indictment proceedings against Keheliya postponed
byline: The Colombo Permanent High Court Trial-at-Bar has postponed the serving of indictments on former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and other accused in the case concerning the import of substandard Human Immunoglobulin vials.

title: Scrutiny grows over Texas flood response as death toll hits 120, 170 still missing
byline: Texas authorities faced mounting scrutiny yesterday over the response to flash flooding that has left at least 120 people dead, as details surfaced about reported delays of early alerts that could have saved lives.

title: Hearing of case against Yoshitha and his grandmother adjourned
byline: The Colombo High Court has directed the Attorney General to recall the case filed against Yoshitha Rajapaksa, son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, and his grandmother, Daisy Forest, under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: Chammani mass graves: ITAK calls for international oversight into excavations
byline: Sri Lanka’s largest Tamil political party, Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK), has written to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake seeking the involvement of independent, internationally respected forensic experts to oversee all stages of the investigation into the mass grave in Chemmani, a village in northern Jaffna.

title: 2024 O/L Exam results released
byline: The results of the 2024 G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination have been released online, the Department of Examination announced.

title: President stresses effective use of Rs. 1,400 bln capital allocation in 2025 budget
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that this year’s budget has allocated the highest capital expenditure by a government in recent history for development activities, amounting to nearly Rs. 1,400 billion.

title: Donald Trump announces 35% tariffs on Canada
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday announced a 35% tariff rate for goods imported from Canada, starting August 1.

title: Original Birkin bag sells at auction for record $10 million
byline: The original bag custom-made for actress Jane Birkin, which became one of the era-defining designs of the 20th century, was sold in Paris on Thursday for a record 8.6 million euros ($10.04 million), auctioneer Sotheby’s said.

title: Decision on petition over Seethawaka PS chairman election to be delivered on July 14
byline: The Court of Appeal has announced that the order on the petition filed against the holding of a secret ballot to elect the Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha, will be delivered on July 14.

title: Trump threatens Brazil with 50% tariff and demands Bolsonaro’s trial end
byline: US President Donald Trump said he was planning to impose a 50% tax on goods made in Brazil, escalating his fight with the South American country.

title: Sri Lanka gets largest US tariff cut, says Deputy Foreign Minister
byline: US President Donald Trump has decided to impose a 30% reciprocal tariff on all goods imported from Sri Lanka. The White House has issued an official letter informing President Anura Kumara Dissanayake of this decision.

title: US issues sanctions against UN investigator probing abuses in Gaza
byline: The Trump administration announced Wednesday that it is issuing sanctions against an independent investigator tasked with probing human rights abuses in the Palestinian territories, the latest effort by the United States to punish critics of Israel’s 21-month war in Gaza.

title: President holds talks with officials on US tariff policy
byline: A special discussion was held at the Presidential Secretariat this morning (10) between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and senior Sri Lankan officials involved in ongoing trade negotiations with the United States, regarding the new tariff policy imposed by the US.

title: Imported milk powder prices increased
byline: The price of a 400g pack of imported milk powder has been increased by Rs. 100, according to the Milk Powder Importers’ Association.

title: 8,355 ‘Dansal’ registered for Esala Poya
byline: A total of 8,355 ‘Dansal’ have been registered across the island in line with Esala Full Moon Poya Day, according to the Public Health Inspectors’ Union (PHIU).

title: Tourist arrivals in Sri Lanka exceed 36,000 in first six days of July
byline: Over 36,000 tourists have arrived in the country in the first six days of July 2025 alone, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) said.

title: Dilith Jayaweera calls for strong economic model amidst US tariff hike
byline: Commenting on US President Donald Trump’s decision to impose a 30% reciprocal tariff on all goods imported from Sri Lanka, the leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance and Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera said the move further underscores the urgent need for Sri Lanka to adopt a strong economic model..

title: Sri Lanka’s apparel industry alarmed by US tariff of 30%, hopes for cut
byline: Distress is in store for Sri Lanka’s garments sector if the island nation is unable to clinch a tariff lower than the 30% figure U.S. President Donald Trump has clamped on imports from Colombo, a top industry body warned on Thursday.

title: Nvidia’s stock market value hits $4 trillion on AI dominance
byline: Nvidia briefly reached a market capitalization of $4 trillion on Wednesday, making it the first company in the world to reach the milestone and solidifying its position as one of Wall Street’s most-favored stocks.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.
